1.details: For example: the numbers in a clock represent amounts of time (minutes, hours).

2.text: The largest number you can find.

3.text: Something from nature with a very geometrical shape.
3.details: A flower, plant, fruit, vegetable, rock, etc.

4.details: A building, sculpture, bridge, arch, doorway, window or other things built by humans.

5.text: A piece of art that uses interesting geometric shapes.

6.text: A group of things too large to be counted.

7.text: A thing whose shape is made of flat surfaces and hard edges, with no curves.

8.text: A thing whose shape is made only of curved surfaces

9.text: Something you imagine required very precise measurements or complex calculations to build.

12.text: As many squares or rectangles as you can fit in the same picture.

13.text: The polygon with the largest amount of sides you can find.
13.details: A polygon is a flat closed shape whose sides are all straight lines.

14.details: Something that is almost perfectly circular, but not quite.

15.details: A triangle formed by edges of things or in the space between things and that is only visible from a particular position and direction.

16.text: A design made by placing geometric shapes one next to the other, with no gaps.
16.details: For example geometric floor or wall tiles.

17.text: Things or shapes arranged in a colorful and symmetrical design.
17.details: Similar to a kaleidoscope, a geometrical flower or the wings of a butterfly.

19.text: A group of things whose color, size or shape follows a repeating pattern.

20.text: A group of similar things that apparently are randomly distributed, following no pattern.

21.text: A group of similar things, ordered by size.

23.text: An object that would be a very fast and exciting slide if you could shrink your body.
